alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Carroll; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 1:01PM EDT until July 16 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Belknap County in central New Hampshire... Northwestern Strafford County in central New Hampshire... Southeastern Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 101 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain capable of producing considerable damage across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen with additional rainfall through the afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ossipee, Moultonborough, Meredith, Farmington, Alton, Barnstead, Gilmanton, Effingham, Wolfeboro and Tamworth. This includes the following Rec locations... Lake Winnipesaukee. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
